    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Add a character whereever the cursor is currently located

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:TextInput:backspace}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput.backspace \textit{(method)}}

    \raggedright \textbf{backspace}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Delete a character before the cursor position

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:TextInput:deccursor}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput.deccursor \textit{(method)}}

    \raggedright \textbf{deccursor}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Move the cursor one space left

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:TextInput:inccursor}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput.inccursor \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{inccursor}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Move the cursor one space right (but not beyond the end of the text)

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:TextInput:drawcursor}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.TextInput.drawcursor \textit{(method)}}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Draw the cursor

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:not_null}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.not\_null \textit{(method)}}

    \raggedright \textbf{not\_null}(\textit{self}, \textit{text})

\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:unselectall}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.unselectall \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{unselectall}(\textit{self}, \textit{force}={\tt False})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Force all the keys to be unselected Marks any that change as dirty to 
    redraw

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:clickatmouse}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.clickatmouse \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{clickatmouse}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Check to see if the user is pressing down on a key and draw it selected

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:togglecaps}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.togglecaps \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{togglecaps}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Toggle uppercase / lowercase

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:selectatmouse}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.selectatmouse \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{selectatmouse}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    User has clicked a key, let's use it

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:addkeys}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.addkeys \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{addkeys}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Adds the setup for the keys.  This would be easy to modify for 
    additional keys

    The default start position places the keyboard slightly left of center 
    by design so many people have issues with the right side of their 
    touchscreens that I did this on purpose.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:paintkeys}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.paintkeys \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{paintkeys}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Draw the keyboard (but only if they're dirty.)

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{pygame-asteroids:virtual_keyboard:VirtualKeyboard:clear}
    \index{pygame-asteroids \textit{(package)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard \textit{(module)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard \textit{(class)}!pygame-asteroids.virtual\_keyboard.VirtualKeyboard.clear \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{clear}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Put the screen back to before we started

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}
